rComments: Professor Fisher was literally the worst professor I've ever had here in santa cruz. I received a B+ in Ochem 108A but couldnt PASS Fisher's class. Try your absolute hardest to not take his course. Do anything you can. STAY AWAY from this guy. You're asking for failure.

Tests are amazingly hard. However, it is a hard class. 30% of the tests were taken from the homework in the book. 16% extra credit was offered for both midterms and 10% was given for the final.  Class average was a 65% ish. Your highest grade counted for double. All in all a hard class but Gary knows this and tweaks the grades.  GO TO CLASS TO PASS

It was the most horrible class I've ever taken. There's a reason he's taught at multiple places and never been tenured.... IMPOSSIBLE TESTS, USELESS LECTURES, AND A SHT ATTITUDE. I'm still mad about it!
Worst professor I have ever had. He would say certain things would not be on the test and then on test day you look at your test and what do you know IT IS ON THE TEST!!!!
I didn't know there were going to mechanisms on the test.

Gary's class was rather rigorous. If you do not take the Ochem series in sequence, he makes it very very difficult for you to get up to speed. Be prepared for a lot of practice and repetition. Be sure to impress Gary with your love for substances that are highly aromatic, like banana oil. Homeboy loves that stuff.

I find him to be extremely unhelpful and I am highly positive that he is the worst professor I have ever had. He thinks he is  high and mighty and talks down on his students. Avoid him. Save yourself a quarter of demeaning talk and unhelpful lectures.

Great professor, raised the standard of Ochem at UCSC. If you want to get the highest score on the final:   Go to at least 1 section a week Go to at least 1 office hour a week Read chapterdo hw before lecture; stay 2 chapters ahead DO ASSIGNED HW 5 TIMES; 5 ROUNDS  Hard class but very rewarding

His tests were impossible to fully complete within the allotted time. His grading scale was far from normal, with the C range being 3 times the % range of a B. Normalizes grades around a C and doesn't expect students to succeed. Office hours do help, but get used to teaching yourself because lectures don't at all.
Hardest and worst professor at UCSC. Hands down. Avoid him at all costs.
Horrible professor. Made me dread the subject. Don't ever take this class with him.

This was the hardest class I've taken in my life. I literally had to rely on the book and teach myself the material. It felt like the only help Fisher provided was choosing problems for you to do. I left the final exam feeling like I failed the class and was fully prepared to retake it but somehow passed, maybe because he made it 50% to pass. AVOID

The worst professor ever. It's strange that there are MANY students who claim he lied about his grading. Yes the curve was generous, but it didn't not matter because many of his students failed. He lies about what is to be on the exam, the final exam specifically. I understand ochem is hard, but he literally made it almost impossible to pass.

Gary Fisher is by far the worst professor I have ever had, and I've had many bad ones. His lectures are dreadful and he is NOT funny despite his horrid attempt to be, even when his students are failing. His tests are outrageously unreasonable and the course material is out of the scope of what students need to know for this class. I could go on..

Overall Fisher is an alright professor. Ochem is tough no matter who the professor is. His lectures weren't that helpful go to his office hours and you'll realize he knows his stuff.  He gives no practice exams but he cherry picks a lot from his recommended problems. No exam curves but finalcurve is generous 50% to pass. Just study more than I did.

Gary was hilarious. But he was so unreasonable. He wasn't terribly helpful, made his tests insanely hard, and laughed at our pain. I basically ended up teaching myself from the book, spent a ton of time learning it, and am still scared to receive my grade.

Worst professor ever, and hope he never teaches again. Everyone bombed the first midterm 20-30% and his curve didn't affect anyone. Second midterm we learned how his tests were so average was 68%. Then the final comes and he puts NOTHING covered in homework problems and covered in lecture. I am so positive he is the worst professor I've ever had.
Lectures would digress unnecessarily to personal anecdotes. He provides no midterm aid or practice tests for his consistently difficult midterms.

Gary is probably the worst professor I've had during my time at UCSC. His lectures are really confusing and his midterms are nightmares. I read the textbook and did the homework along with attending lectures, and I'm still probably not going to pass. Avoid at all costs.

Worst professor I've had at UCSC and that's saying a lot. His lectures are like story time where he talks about how good other chemists are and his lecture notes rarely help. He has no practice midterms or final. If you want to learn ochem from the bookTA then by all means take it with him, but if you actually want a good professor avoid this guy.
He expects a lot out of his students. Really use the book and do the practice problems. His midterms are no joke, take them seriously and prepare for them well ahead of time.

FIsher's personality is great. He's funny and he gives entertaining stories all the time. His midterms AREN'T HARD. Half of the problems are taken from the ones he recommends from the textbook. Just study and you'll do well. 90% of the class did bomb the 1st test, but the curve ended up being insane. 2nd one was easy. In the end, it's chem. Study.

A really funny guy, but by no means  worth the UC tution you will pay. Had to teach myself out of the book and will likely fail this course. lecture was 90 minutes of him self promoting and very little teaching. Angers me to know that this is what a UC education entails. Makes jokes about the difficulty of the material
